alert.note: Alert for Pecos; Presidio; Reeves; Terrell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 7:32AM CDT until further notice by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT/945 AM MDT/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Texas and western Texas, including the following counties, in southwest Texas, Brewster, Culberson, Jeff Davis, Pecos, Presidio, Reeves and Terrell. In western Texas, Crane and Ward. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM CDT /945 AM MDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 732 AM CDT /632 AM MDT/, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pecos, Fort Stockton, Alpine, Marfa, Kent, Toyah, Fort Davis, Sheffield, Balmorhea, Grandfalls, Barstow, Marathon, Saragosa, Balmorhea Lake, Balmorhea State Park, Alpine- Casparis Municipal Airport, Camp Mitre Peak, Davis Mountains State Park, McDonald Observatory and Marfa Municipal Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
